intro: Pleocnemia cumingiana, commonly known as the Cuming's pleocnemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often visited by various pollinators, including bees and birds. The plant has limited economic importance but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
